test_message: I live in a 2-bedroom apartment with a small balcony. I work from home 3 days a week and am moderately active (daily 30-minute walks). I've had cats before but never dogs. I'm open to special needs animals and prefer calm, affectionate pets. Available animals: 1) Bella - 5yr old Labrador, high energy, needs experienced owner, large yard required. 2) Max - 3yr old tabby cat, calm, good for apartments, low maintenance. 3) Luna - 2yr old mixed breed, moderate energy, friendly, adaptable to apartments.
expected_purpose: Manager agent that orchestrates compatibility analysis and returns ranked pet matches with detailed compatibility breakdowns

result.match_summary: Your adopter profile strongly favors calm, affectionate, low-maintenance pets that thrive in apartment settings and benefit from a companionship-focused lifestyle. Max the tabby cat is a near-optimal match, combining ideal temperament, environmental compatibility, and your previous experience. Luna the mixed breed dog is also viable due to her adaptability and moderate energy, though your limited dog experience and a need for some extra support/training are notable. Bella the Labrador is not recommended due to significant mismatches in energy, space, and the requirement for an experienced dog owner.
result.adopter_profile_summary: You offer a stable, compassionate, and pet-ready home for calm, lower-energy pets. Previous cat ownership, a part-time work-from-home schedule, and openness to special needs all support successful adoption—especially of cats or dog breeds comfortable with apartment life and moderate activity.

top_recommendations.why_this_match: Max is a calm, affectionate, and low-maintenance cat—perfect for apartment living and an adopter with prior cat experience. Your routine allows for regular attention and companionship, and your openness to special needs matches well with any additional care Max might require.
key_strengths: Low-maintenance needs perfectly fit your schedule and prior knowledge
important_considerations: Ensure Max's enrichment needs are met within an apartment setting
Check for any hidden health or behavioral matters during the adoption process
next_steps: Schedule an in-person meeting with Max
Consult with shelter staff about his medical/behavioral background
If comfortable, begin pre-adoption preparations at home

top_recommendations.why_this_match: Luna’s moderate energy and friendly, adaptable nature make her an option for first-time dog owners in apartments. Your willingness to learn and provide time, combined with Luna’s suitability for indoor living, create a path for positive adoption—provided you seek out additional resources and guidance.
key_strengths: Room for growth as a new dog owner
important_considerations: Expect a learning curve in training and care routines
More exercise and supervision required than with a cat
next_steps: Connect with dog trainers or shelter support for basic care guidance
Arrange a trial visit with Luna

matching_insights.best_fit_category: Calm, affectionate companion animals thriving in apartment environments—especially cats and well-adjusted, moderate-energy dogs.
lifestyle_highlights: Stable home with moderate daily routine
Prior experience with cats for seamless transition
Openness to special needs, increasing chance for meaningful placement
preparation_recommendations: Cat-proof or dog-proof your space to reduce risk and add enrichment
Plan a slow, supervised acclimation period
Prepare supplies tailored to the species and any special care needs

result.conversation_context: Adopter profile and match analysis favor calm, apartment-friendly pets. Previous cat experience and openness to special needs are key advantages. Top recommendations reflect both readiness and potential growth areas for successful adoption.
